story.hline: Rain denies Shubman Gill his maiden 100
story.intro: India finish with 225/3 in 36 overs; West Indies chasing DLS revised target of 257 in 35 overs
story.seoHeadline: Rain denies Shubman Gill his maiden 100

coverImage.caption: Shubman Gill was stranded on run-a-ball 98*

story.intro: In the backdrop of South Africa withdrawing from their ODI tour of Australia and Ben Stokes quitting the format, many have questioned the relevance of 50-over cricket

coverImage.caption: The ICC has defended the ODI format despite many questioning the relevance of 50-over cricket

story.hline: Nottinghamshire in pole position after Haseeb Hameed 94
story.intro: Elsewhere, Kyle Abbott and Mohammad Abbas share seven as Yorkshire are bowled out for 272
story.seoHeadline: Nottinghamshire in pole position after Haseeb Hameed 94

coverImage.caption: Hameed fell six short of his hundred

story.hline: Finn Allen's maiden ton sinks Scotland in series opener
story.intro: Allen smashed 101 off 56 to power New Zealand to 225, a total that Scotland fell well short of
story.seoHeadline: Finn Allen's maiden ton sinks Scotland in series opener

coverImage.caption: Finn Allen hit eight fours and six sixes in his knock.

story.hline: Asia Cup 2022 officially moved to UAE
story.intro: Sri Lanka Cricket will retain hosting rights of the tournament, which will be played between August 27 and September 11
story.seoHeadline: Asia Cup 2022 officially moved to UAE

coverImage.caption: The UAE also hosted the previous edition of the tournament, in the ODI format in 2018, an event that was won by India

story.hline: Dhananjaya ton headlines another day of SL dominance
story.intro: Pakistan need 419 runs on the final day with nine wickets in hand
story.seoHeadline: Dhananjaya de Silva ton headlines another day of Sri Lanka dominance

coverImage.caption: Dhananjaya de Silva notched up his ninth Test century

story.hline: Sri Lanka dismiss Shafique after setting massive target
story.intro: A century from Dhananjaya de Silva left the visitors needing 508 in the fourth innings for victory
story.seoHeadline: Sri Lanka dismiss Shafique after setting massive target

coverImage.caption: Dhananjaya de Silva celebrates getting to his century.

story.hline: Dhananjaya nears ton as Sri Lanka stretch lead past 400
story.intro: Riding on the back of half-centuries by Dhananjaya de Silva and Dimuth Karunaratne, Sri Lanka extended their lead to 444 at Lunch on Day 4
story.seoHeadline: Dhananjaya de Silva nears ton as Sri Lanka stretch lead past 400

coverImage.caption: Dhananjaya was unbeaten on 84 when lunch was taken

story.hline: We are sticking through these tough times: Nicholas Pooran
story.intro: After losing yet another ODI series to India, the West Indies skipper said that the players are 'hurting' but at the same time confident of steering the side back to winning ways
story.seoHeadline: We are sticking through these tough times, says Pooran, West Indies

coverImage.caption: "I keep telling winning and losing is contagious and at the moment in ODI cricket we're losing and we're finding ways to lose games," Pooran

story.hline: County Wrap: Ollie Pope fifty gives Surrey lead
story.intro: Elsewhere, Derbyshire staged a great comeback in the final session to turn the tables against Worcestershire
story.seoHeadline: County Wrap: Ollie Pope fifty gives Surrey lead
